fr.verse_71: Le jour où Nous appellerons chaque groupement d'hommes par leur chef, ceux à qui on remettra leur livre dans la main droite liront leur livre (avec plaisir) et ne subiront pas la moindre injustice.
fr.verse_72: Et quiconque aura été aveugle ici-bas, sera aveugle dans l'au-delà, et sera plus égaré [encore] par rapport à la bonne voie.
fr.verse_73: Ils ont failli te détourner de ce que Nous t'avions révélé, [dans l'espoir] qu'à la place de ceci, tu inventes quelque chose d'autre et (l'imputes) à Nous. Et alors, ils t'auraient pris pour ami intime.
fr.verse_74: Et si Nous ne t'avions pas raffermi, tu aurais bien failli t'incliner quelque peu vers eux.
fr.verse_75: Alors, Nous t'aurions certes fait goûter le double [supplice] de la vie et le double [supplice] de la mort; et ensuite tu n'aurais pas trouvé de secoureur contre Nous.
fr.verse_76: En vérité, ils ont failli t'inciter à fuir du pays pour t'en bannir. Mais dans ce cas, ils n'y seraient pas restés longtemps après toi.
fr.verse_77: Telle fut la règle appliquée par Nous à Nos messagers que Nous avons envoyés avant toi. Et tu ne trouveras pas de changement en Notre règle.
fr.verse_78: Accomplis la Salât au déclin du soleil jusqu'à l'obscurité de la nuit, et [fais] aussi la Lecture à l'aube, car la Lecture à l'aube a des témoins.
fr.verse_79: Et de la nuit consacre une partie [avant l'aube] pour des Salât surérogatoires: afin que ton Seigneur te ressuscite en une position de gloire.
fr.verse_80: Et dis: «O mon Seigneur, fais que j'entre par une entrée de vérité et que je sorte par une sortie de vérité; et accorde-moi de Ta part, un pouvoir bénéficiant de Ton secours».
fr.verse_81: Et dis: «La Vérité (l'Islam) est venue et l'Erreur a disparu. Car l'Erreur est destinée à disparaître».
fr.verse_82: Nous faisons descendre du Coran, ce qui est une guérison et une miséricorde pour les croyants. Cependant, cela ne fait qu'accroître la perdition des injustes.
fr.verse_83: Et quand Nous comblons l'homme de bienfaits, il se détourne et se replie sur lui-même; et quand un mal le touche, le voilà profondément désespéré.
fr.verse_84: Dis: «Chacun agit selon sa méthode, alors que votre Seigneur connaît mieux qui suit la meilleure voie».
fr.verse_85: Et ils t'interrogent au sujet de l'âme, - Dis: «L'âme relève de l'Ordre de mon Seigneur». Et on ne vous a donné que peu de connaissance.
fr.verse_86: Si Nous voulons, Nous pouvons certes faire disparaître ce que Nous t'avons révélé; et tu n'y trouverais par la suite aucun défenseur contre Nous.
fr.verse_87: Si ce n'est par une miséricorde de ton Seigneur, car en vérité Sa grâce sur toi est grande.
fr.verse_88: Dis: «Même si les hommes et les djinns s'unissaient pour produire quelque chose de semblable à ce Coran, ils ne sauraient produire rien de semblable, même s'ils se soutenaient les uns les autres».
fr.verse_89: Et certes, Nous avons déployé pour les gens, dans ce Coran, toutes sortes d'exemples. Mais la plupart des gens s'obstinent à être mécréants.
fr.verse_90: Et ils dirent: «Nous ne croirons pas en toi, jusqu'à ce que tu aies fait jaillir de terre, pour nous, une source;
fr.verse_91: ou que tu aies un jardin de palmiers et de vignes, entre lesquels tu feras jaillir des ruisseaux en abondance;
fr.verse_92: ou que tu fasses tomber sur nous, comme tu le prétends, le ciel en morceaux; ou que tu fasses venir Allah et les Anges en face de nous;
fr.verse_93: ou que tu aies une maison [garnie] d'ornements; ou que tu sois monté au ciel. Encore ne croirons-nous pas à ta montée au ciel, jusqu'à ce que tu fasses descendre sur nous un Livre que nous puissions lire». Dis-[leur]: «Gloire à mon Seigneur! Ne suis-je qu'un être humain-Messager?»
fr.verse_94: Et rien n'empêcha les gens de croire, quand le guide leur est parvenu, si ce n'est qu'ils disaient: «Allah envoie-t-Il un être humain-Messager?»
fr.verse_95: Dis: «S'il y avait sur terre des Anges marchant tranquillement, Nous aurions certes fait descendre sur eux du ciel un Ange-Messager».
fr.verse_96: Dis: «Allah suffit comme témoin entre vous et moi». Il est, sur Ses serviteurs, Parfaitement Connaisseur et Clairvoyant.
fr.verse_97: Celui qu'Allah guide, c'est lui le bien-guidé et ceux qu'Il égare... tu ne leur trouveras jamais d'alliés en dehors de Lui et au Jour de la Résurrection, Nous les rassemblerons traînés sur leurs visages, aveugles, muets et sourds. L'Enfer sera leur demeure: chaque fois que son feu s'affaiblit, Nous leur accroîtrons la flamme ardente.
fr.verse_98: Telle sera leur sanction parce qu'ils ne croient pas en Nos preuves et disent: «Quand nous serons ossements et poussière, serons-nous ressuscités en une nouvelle création?»
fr.verse_99: N'ont-ils pas vu qu'Allah qui a créé les cieux et la terre est capable de créer leurs pareils? Il leur a fixé un terme, sur lequel il n'y a aucun doute, mais les injustes s'obstinent dans leur mécréance.
fr.verse_100: Dis: «Si c'était vous qui possédiez les trésors de la miséricorde de mon Seigneur, vous lésineriez, certes, de peur de les dépenser. Et l'homme est très avare!
fr.verse_101: Et certes, Nous donnâmes à Moïse neuf miracles évidents. Demande donc aux Enfants d'Israël, lorsqu'il leur vint et que Pharaon lui dit: «O Moïse, je pense que tu es ensorcelé».
fr.verse_102: Il dit: «Tu sais fort bien que ces choses [les miracles], seul le Seigneur des cieux et de la terre les a fait descendre comme autant de preuves illuminantes; et certes, O Pharaon, je te crois perdu».
fr.verse_103: [Pharaon] voulut donc les expulser du pays. Alors Nous les noyâmes tous, lui et ceux qui étaient avec lui.
fr.verse_104: Et après lui, Nous dîmes aux Enfants d'Israël: «Habitez la terre». Puis, lorsque viendra la promesse de la (vie) dernière, Nous vous ferons venir en foule.
fr.verse_105: Et c'est en toute vérité que Nous l'avons fait descendre (le Coran), et avec la vérité il est descendu, et Nous ne t'avons envoyé qu'en annonciateur et avertisseur.
fr.verse_106: (Nous avons fait descendre) un Coran que Nous avons fragmenté, pour que tu le lises lentement aux gens. Et Nous l'avons fait descendre graduellement.
fr.verse_107: Dis: «Croyez-y ou n'y croyez pas. Ceux à qui la connaissance a été donnée avant cela, lorsqu'on le leur récite, tombent, prosternés, le menton contre terre
fr.verse_108: et disent: «Gloire à notre Seigneur! La promesse de notre Seigneur est assurément accomplie».
fr.verse_109: Et ils tombent sur leur menton, pleurant, et cela augmente leur humilité.
fr.verse_110: Dis: «Invoquez Allah, ou invoquez le Tout Miséricordieux. Quel que soit le nom par lequel vous l'appelez, Il a les plus beaux noms. Et dans ta Salât, ne récite pas à voix haute; et ne l'y abaisse pas trop, mais cherche le juste milieu entre les deux».
fr.verse_111: Et dis: «Louange à Allah qui ne S'est jamais attribué d'enfant, qui n'a point d'associé en la royauté et qui n'a jamais eu de protecteur de l'humiliation». Et proclame hautement Sa grandeur.

en.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
en.verse_1: Glory to Him who journeyed His servant by night, from the Sacred Mosque, to the Farthest Mosque, whose precincts We have blessed, in order to show him of Our wonders. He is the Listener, the Beholder.
en.verse_2: And We gave Moses the Scripture, and made it a guide for the Children of Israel: Take none for protector other than Me.
en.verse_3: The descendants of those We carried with Noah. He was an appreciative servant.
en.verse_4: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture: You will commit evil on earth twice, and you will rise to a great height.
en.verse_5: When the first of the two promises came true, We sent against you servants of Ours, possessing great might, and they ransacked your homes. It was a promise fulfilled.
en.verse_6: Then We gave you back your turn against them, and supplied you with wealth and children, and made you more numerous.
en.verse_7: If you work righteousness, you work righteousness for yourselves; and if you commit evil, you do so against yourselves. Then, when the second promise comes true, they will make your faces filled with sorrow, and enter the Temple as they entered it the first time, and utterly destroy all that falls into their power.
en.verse_8: Perhaps your Lord will have mercy on you. But if you revert, We will revert. We have made Hell a prison for the disbelievers.
en.verse_9: This Quran guides to what is most upright; and it gives good news to the believers who do good deeds, that they will have a great reward.
en.verse_10: And those who do not believe in the Hereafter-We have prepared for them a painful punishment.
en.verse_11: The human being prays for evil as he prays for good. The human being is very hasty.
en.verse_12: We have made the night and the day two wonders. We erased the wonder of the night, and made the wonder of the day revealing, that you may seek bounty from your Lord, and know the number of years, and the calculation. We have explained all things in detail.
en.verse_13: For every person We have attached his fate to his neck. And on the Day of Resurrection, We will bring out for him a book which he will find spread open.
en.verse_14: "Read your book; today there will be none but yourself to call you to account."
en.verse_15: Whoever is guided-is guided for his own good. And whoever goes astray-goes astray to his detriment. No burdened soul carries the burdens of another, nor do We ever punish until We have sent a messenger.
en.verse_16: When We decide to destroy a town, We command its affluent ones, they transgress in it, so the word becomes justified against it, and We destroy it completely.
en.verse_17: How many generations have We destroyed after Noah? Your Lord is sufficient as Knower and Beholder of the sins of his servants.
en.verse_18: Whoever desires the fleeting life, We expedite for him what We decide to give him, to whomever We desire. Then We consign him to Hell, where he will roast, condemned and defeated.
en.verse_19: But whoever desires the Hereafter, and pursues it as it should be pursued, while he is a believer; these-their effort will be appreciated.
en.verse_20: To all-these and those-We extend from the gifts of your Lord. The gifts of your Lord are not restricted.
en.verse_21: See how We have favored some of them over others; yet the Hereafter is greater in ranks, and greater in favors.
en.verse_22: Do not set up another god with God, lest you become condemned and damned.
en.verse_23: Your Lord has commanded that you worship none but Him, and that you be good to your parents. If either of them or both of them reach old age with you, do not say to them a word of disrespect, nor scold them, but say to them kind words.
en.verse_24: And lower to them the wing of humility, out of mercy, and say, "My Lord, have mercy on them, as they raised me when I was a child."
en.verse_25: Your Lord knows best what is in your minds. If you are righteous-He is Forgiving to the obedient.
en.verse_26: And give the relative his rights, and the poor, and the wayfarer, and do not squander wastefully.
en.verse_27: The extravagant are brethren of the devils, and the devil is ever ungrateful to his Lord.
en.verse_28: But if you turn away from them, seeking mercy from your Lord which you hope for, then say to them words of comfort.
en.verse_29: And do not keep your hand tied to your neck, nor spread it out fully, lest you end up liable and regretful.
en.verse_30: Your Lord expands the provision for whomever He wills, and restricts it. He is fully Informed, Observant of His servants.
en.verse_31: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them, and for you. Killing them is a grave sin.
en.verse_32: And do not come near adultery. It is immoral, and an evil way.
en.verse_33: And do not kill the soul which God has made sacred, except in the course of justice. If someone is killed unjustly, We have given his next of kin certain authority. But he should not be excessive in killing, for he will be supported.
en.verse_34: And do not go near the orphan's property, except with the best of intentions, until he has reached his maturity. And honor your pledge, because the pledge involves responsibility.
en.verse_35: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with accurate scales. That is fair, and the best determination.
en.verse_36: And do not occupy yourself with what you have no knowledge of. The hearing, and the sight, and the brains-all these will be questioned.
en.verse_37: And do not walk proudly on earth. You can neither pierce the earth, nor can you match the mountains in height.
en.verse_38: The evil of all these is disliked by your Lord.
en.verse_39: That is some of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. Do not set up with God another god, or else you will be thrown in Hell, rebuked and banished.
en.verse_40: Has your Lord favored you with sons, while choosing for Himself daughters from among the angels? You are indeed saying a terrible thing.
en.verse_41: We have explained in this Quran in various ways, that they may remember, but it only adds to their rebellion.
en.verse_42: Say, "If there were other gods with Him, as they say, they would have sought a way to the Lord of the Throne."
en.verse_43: Be He glorified. He is exalted, far above what they say.
en.verse_44: Praising Him are the seven heavens, and the earth, and everyone in them. There is not a thing that does not glorify Him with praise, but you do not understand their praises. He is indeed Forbearing and Forgiving.
en.verse_45: When you read the Quran, We place between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter an invisible barrier.
en.verse_46: And We drape veils over their hearts, preventing them from understanding it, and heaviness in their ears. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.
en.verse_47: We know well what they listen to, when they listen to you, as they conspire, when the wrongdoers say, "You only follow a man bewitched."
en.verse_48: Note what they compared you to. They are lost, and unable to find a way.
en.verse_49: And they say, "When we have become bones and fragments, shall we really be resurrected as a new creation?"
en.verse_50: Say, "Even if you become rocks or iron.
en.verse_51: Or some substance, which, in your minds, is even harder." Then they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "The One who originated you the first time." Then they will nod their heads at you, and say, "When will it be?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon."
en.verse_52: On the Day when He calls you, you will respond with His praise, and you will realize that you stayed only a little.
en.verse_53: Tell My servants to say what is best. Satan sows discord among them. Satan is to man an open enemy.
en.verse_54: Your Lord knows you best. If He wills, He will have mercy on you; and if He wills, He will punish you. We did not send you as their advocate.
en.verse_55: Your Lord knows well everyone in the heavens and the earth. We have given some prophets advantage over others; and to David We gave the Psalms.
en.verse_56: Say, "Call upon those you claim besides Him. They have no power to relieve your adversity, nor can they change it."
en.verse_57: Those they call upon are themselves seeking means of access to their Lord, vying to be nearer, and hoping for His mercy, and fearing His punishment. The punishment of your Lord is to be dreaded.
en.verse_58: There is no city but We will destroy before the Day of Resurrection, or punish it with a severe punishment. This is inscribed in the Book.
en.verse_59: Nothing prevents Us from sending miraculous signs, except that the ancients called them lies. We gave Thamood the she-camel, a visible sign, but they mistreated her. We do not send the signs except to instill reverence.
en.verse_60: We said to you that your Lord encompasses humanity. We did not make the vision We showed you, except as a test for the people, and the tree cursed in the Quran. We frighten them, but that only increases their defiance.
en.verse_61: When We said to the angels, "Bow down before Adam," they bowed down, except for Satan. He said, "Shall I bow down before someone You created from mud?"
en.verse_62: He said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored more than me? If You reprieve me until the Day of Resurrection, I will bring his descendants under my sway, except for a few."
en.verse_63: He said, "Begone! Whoever of them follows you-Hell is your reward, an ample reward."
en.verse_64: "And entice whomever of them you can with your voice, and rally against them your cavalry and your infantry, and share with them in wealth and children, and make promises to them." But Satan promises them nothing but delusion.
en.verse_65: "As for My devotees, you have no authority over them." Your Lord is an adequate Guardian.
en.verse_66: Your Lord is He who propels for you the ships at sea, that you may seek of His bounty. He is towards you Most Merciful.
en.verse_67: When harm afflicts you at sea, those you pray to vanish, except for Him. But when He saves you to land, you turn away. The human being is ever thankless.
en.verse_68: Are you confident that He will not cause a track of land to cave in beneath you, or unleash a tornado against you, and then you find no protector?
en.verse_69: Or are you confident that He will not return you to it once again, and unleash a hurricane against you, and drown you for your ingratitude? Then you will find no helper against Us.
en.verse_70: We have honored the Children of Adam, and carried them on land and sea, and provided them with good things, and greatly favored them over many of those We created.
en.verse_71: On the Day when We call every people with their leader. Whoever is given his record in his right hand-these will read their record, and they will not be wronged one bit.
en.verse_72: But whoever is blind in this, he will be blind in the Hereafter, and further astray from the way.
en.verse_73: They almost lured you away from what We have revealed to you, so that you would invent something else in Our name. In that case, they would have taken you for a friend.
en.verse_74: Had We not given you stability, you might have inclined towards them a little.
en.verse_75: Then We would have made you taste double in life, and double at death; then you would have found for yourself no helper against Us.
en.verse_76: They almost provoked you, to expel you from the land. In that case, they would not have lasted after you, except briefly.
en.verse_77: The tradition of the messengers We sent before you-you will find no change in Our rules.
en.verse_78: Perform the prayer at the decline of the sun, until the darkness of the night; and the Quran at dawn. The Quran at dawn is witnessed.
en.verse_79: And keep vigil with it during parts of the night, as an extra prayer. Perhaps your Lord will raise you to a laudable position.
en.verse_80: And say, "My Lord, lead me in through an entry of truth, and lead me out through an exit of truth, and grant me from You a supporting power."
en.verse_81: And say, "The truth has come, and falsehood has withered away; for falsehood is bound to wither away."
en.verse_82: We send down in the Quran healing and mercy for the believers, but it increases the wrongdoers only in loss.
en.verse_83: When We bless the human being, he turns away and distances himself. But when adversity touches him, he is in despair.
en.verse_84: Say, "Each does according to his disposition. Your Lord knows best who is better guided in the way."
en.verse_85: And they ask you about the Spirit. Say, "The Spirit belongs to the domain of my Lord; and you were given only little knowledge."
en.verse_86: If We willed, We could take away what We revealed to you. Then you will find for yourself no protecting guardian against Us.
en.verse_87: Except through a mercy from your Lord. His favors upon you have been great.
en.verse_88: Say, "If mankind and jinn came together to produce the like of this Quran, they could never produce the like of it, even if they backed up one another."
en.verse_89: We have displayed for mankind in this Quran every kind of similitude, but most people insist on denying the truth.
en.verse_90: And they said, "We will not believe in you unless you make a spring burst from the ground for us.
en.verse_91: Or you have a garden of palms and vines; then cause rivers to gush pouring through them.
en.verse_92: Or make the sky fall on us in pieces, as you claim, or bring God and the angels before us.
en.verse_93: Or you possess a house of gold. Or you ascend into the sky. Even then, we will not believe in your ascension, unless you bring down for us a book that we can read." Say, "Glory be to my Lord. Am I anything but a human messenger?"
en.verse_94: Nothing prevented the people from believing, when guidance has come to them, except that they said, "Did God send a human messenger?"
en.verse_95: Say, "If there were angels on earth, walking around in peace, We would have sent down to them from heaven an angel messenger."
en.verse_96: Say, "God is enough witness between you and me. He is fully aware of His servants, and He sees them well."
en.verse_97: Whomever God guides is the guided one. And whomever He leaves astray-for them you will find no protectors apart from Him. And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection, on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf. Their abode is Hell; whenever it abates, We intensify the blaze for them.
en.verse_98: This is their repayment for having blasphemed against Our revelations, and having said, "Shall we, when we have become bones and fragments, be resurrected as a new creation?"
en.verse_99: Do they not consider that God, Who created the heavens and the earth, is Able to create the likes of them? He has assigned for them a term, in which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers persist in denying the truth.
en.verse_100: Say, "If you possessed the treasuries of my Lord's mercy, you would have withheld them for fear of spending." The human being has always been stingy.
en.verse_101: We gave Moses nine clear signs-ask the Children of Israel. When he went to them, Pharaoh said to him, "I think that you, Moses, are bewitched."
en.verse_102: He said, "You know that none sent these down except the Lord of the heavens and the earth-eye openers; and I think that you, Pharaoh, are doomed."
en.verse_103: He resolved to scare them off the land, but We drowned him, and those with him, altogether.
en.verse_104: After him, We said to the Children of Israel, "Inhabit the land, and when the promise of the Hereafter arrives, We will bring you all together."
en.verse_105: With the truth We sent it down, and with the truth it descended. We sent you only as a bearer of good news and a warner.
en.verse_106: A Quran which We unfolded gradually, that you may recite to the people over time. And We revealed it in stages.
en.verse_107: Say, "Believe in it, or do not believe." Those who were given knowledge before it, when it is recited to them, they fall to their chins, prostrating.
en.verse_108: And they say, "Glory to our Lord. The promise of our Lord is fulfilled."
en.verse_109: And they fall to their chins, weeping, and it adds to their humility.
en.verse_110: Say, "Call Him God, or call Him the Most Merciful. Whichever name you use, to Him belong the Best Names." And be neither loud in your prayer, nor silent in it, but follow a course in between.
en.verse_111: And say, "Praise be to God, who has not begotten a son, nor has He a partner in sovereignty, nor has He an ally out of weakness, and glorify Him constantly."

ar.verse_1: ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَلَمْ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ عِوَجَا ۜ
ar.verse_2: قَيِّمًۭا لِّيُنذِرَ بَأْسًۭا شَدِيدًۭا مِّن لَّدُنْهُ وَيُبَشِّرَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ أَنَّ لَهُمْ أَجْرًا حَسَنًۭا
ar.verse_3: مَّٰكِثِينَ فِيهِ أَبَدًۭا
ar.verse_4: وَيُنذِرَ ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱللَّهُ وَلَدًۭا
ar.verse_5: مَّا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنْ عِلْمٍۢ وَلَا لِءَابَآئِهِمْ ۚ كَبُرَتْ كَلِمَةًۭ تَخْرُجُ مِنْ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ ۚ إِن يَقُولُونَ إِلَّا كَذِبًۭا
ar.verse_6: فَلَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٌۭ نَّفْسَكَ عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَٰرِهِمْ إِن لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِهَٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ أَسَفًا
ar.verse_7: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا مَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ زِينَةًۭ لَّهَا لِنَبْلُوَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًۭا
ar.verse_8: وَإِنَّا لَجَٰعِلُونَ مَا عَلَيْهَا صَعِيدًۭا جُرُزًا
ar.verse_9: أَمْ حَسِبْتَ أَنَّ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْكَهْفِ وَٱلرَّقِيمِ كَانُوا۟ مِنْ ءَايَٰتِنَا عَجَبًا
ar.verse_10: إِذْ أَوَى ٱلْفِتْيَةُ إِلَى ٱلْكَهْفِ فَقَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةًۭ وَهَيِّئْ لَنَا مِنْ أَمْرِنَا رَشَدًۭا
ar.verse_11: فَضَرَبْنَا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ فِى ٱلْكَهْفِ سِنِينَ عَدَدًۭا
ar.verse_12: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَٰهُمْ لِنَعْلَمَ أَىُّ ٱلْحِزْبَيْنِ أَحْصَىٰ لِمَا لَبِثُوٓا۟ أَمَدًۭا
ar.verse_13: نَّحْنُ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ نَبَأَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ فِتْيَةٌ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ وَزِدْنَٰهُمْ هُدًۭى
ar.verse_14: وَرَبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ إِذْ قَامُوا۟ فَقَالُوا۟ رَبُّنَا رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ لَن نَّدْعُوَا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ إِلَٰهًۭا ۖ لَّقَدْ قُلْنَآ إِذًۭا شَطَطًا
ar.verse_15: هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوْمُنَا ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةًۭ ۖ لَّوْلَا يَأْتُونَ عَلَيْهِم بِسُلْطَٰنٍۭ بَيِّنٍۢ ۖ فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًۭا
ar.verse_16: وَإِذِ ٱعْتَزَلْتُمُوهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ فَأْوُۥٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلْكَهْفِ يَنشُرْ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِهِۦ وَيُهَيِّئْ لَكُم مِّنْ أَمْرِكُم مِّرْفَقًۭا
ar.verse_17: ۞ وَتَرَى ٱلشَّمْسَ إِذَا طَلَعَت تَّزَٰوَرُ عَن كَهْفِهِمْ ذَاتَ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَإِذَا غَرَبَت تَّقْرِضُهُمْ ذَاتَ ٱلشِّمَالِ وَهُمْ فِى فَجْوَةٍۢ مِّنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ ءَايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ مَن يَهْدِ ٱللَّهُ فَهُوَ ٱلْمُهْتَدِ ۖ وَمَن يُضْلِلْ فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُۥ وَلِيًّۭا مُّرْشِدًۭا
ar.verse_18: وَتَحْسَبُهُمْ أَيْقَاظًۭا وَهُمْ رُقُودٌۭ ۚ وَنُقَلِّبُهُمْ ذَاتَ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَذَاتَ ٱلشِّمَالِ ۖ وَكَلْبُهُم بَٰسِطٌۭ ذِرَاعَيْهِ بِٱلْوَصِيدِ ۚ لَوِ ٱطَّلَعْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ لَوَلَّيْتَ مِنْهُمْ فِرَارًۭا وَلَمُلِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ رُعْبًۭا
ar.verse_19: وَكَذَٰلِكَ بَعَثْنَٰهُمْ لِيَتَسَآءَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ قَالَ قَآئِلٌۭ مِّنْهُمْ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍۢ ۚ قَالُوا۟ رَبُّكُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثْتُمْ فَٱبْعَثُوٓا۟ أَحَدَكُم بِوَرِقِكُمْ هَٰذِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ فَلْيَنظُرْ أَيُّهَآ أَزْكَىٰ طَعَامًۭا فَلْيَأْتِكُم بِرِزْقٍۢ مِّنْهُ وَلْيَتَلَطَّفْ وَلَا يُشْعِرَنَّ بِكُمْ أَحَدًا
ar.verse_20: إِنَّهُمْ إِن يَظْهَرُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ يَرْجُمُوكُمْ أَوْ يُعِيدُوكُمْ فِى مِلَّتِهِمْ وَلَن تُفْلِحُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًۭا
ar.verse_21: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَعْثَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ لِيَعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ وَأَنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهَآ إِذْ يَتَنَٰزَعُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَمْرَهُمْ ۖ فَقَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ عَلَيْهِم بُنْيَٰنًۭا ۖ رَّبُّهُمْ أَعْلَمُ بِهِمْ ۚ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ غَلَبُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرِهِمْ لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيْهِم مَّسْجِدًۭا
ar.verse_22: سَيَقُولُونَ ثَلَٰثَةٌۭ رَّابِعُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ وَيَقُولُونَ خَمْسَةٌۭ سَادِسُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ رَجْمًۢا بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۖ وَيَقُولُونَ سَبْعَةٌۭ وَثَامِنُهُمْ كَلْبُهُمْ ۚ قُل رَّبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم مَّا يَعْلَمُهُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌۭ ۗ فَلَا تُمَارِ فِيهِمْ إِلَّا مِرَآءًۭ ظَٰهِرًۭا وَلَا تَسْتَفْتِ فِيهِم مِّنْهُمْ أَحَدًۭا
ar.verse_23: وَلَا تَقُولَنَّ لِشَا۟ىْءٍ إِنِّى فَاعِلٌۭ ذَٰلِكَ غَدًا
ar.verse_24: إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَٱذْكُر رَّبَّكَ إِذَا نَسِيتَ وَقُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَهْدِيَنِ رَبِّى لِأَقْرَبَ مِنْ هَٰذَا رَشَدًۭا
ar.verse_25: وَلَبِثُوا۟ فِى كَهْفِهِمْ ثَلَٰثَ مِا۟ئَةٍۢ سِنِينَ وَٱزْدَادُوا۟ تِسْعًۭا
ar.verse_26: قُلِ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثُوا۟ ۖ لَهُۥ غَيْبُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ أَبْصِرْ بِهِۦ وَأَسْمِعْ ۚ مَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَلِىٍّۢ وَلَا يُشْرِكُ فِى حُكْمِهِۦٓ أَحَدًۭا
ar.verse_27: وَٱتْلُ مَآ أُوحِىَ إِلَيْكَ مِن كِتَابِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَا مُبَدِّلَ لِكَلِمَٰتِهِۦ وَلَن تَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلْتَحَدًۭا
ar.verse_28: وَٱصْبِرْ نَفْسَكَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَدَوٰةِ وَٱلْعَشِىِّ يُرِيدُونَ وَجْهَهُۥ ۖ وَلَا تَعْدُ عَيْنَاكَ عَنْهُمْ تُرِيدُ زِينَةَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَا تُطِعْ مَنْ أَغْفَلْنَا قَلْبَهُۥ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ وَكَانَ أَمْرُهُۥ فُرُطًۭا
ar.verse_29: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ فَلْيُؤْمِن وَمَن شَآءَ فَلْيَكْفُرْ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ نَارًا أَحَاطَ بِهِمْ سُرَادِقُهَا ۚ وَإِن يَسْتَغِيثُوا۟ يُغَاثُوا۟ بِمَآءٍۢ كَٱلْمُهْلِ يَشْوِى ٱلْوُجُوهَ ۚ بِئْسَ ٱلشَّرَابُ وَسَآءَتْ مُرْتَفَقًا
ar.verse_30: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ إِنَّا لَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ مَنْ أَحْسَنَ عَمَلًا
ar.verse_31: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ جَنَّٰتُ عَدْنٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهِمُ ٱلْأَنْهَٰرُ يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍۢ وَيَلْبَسُونَ ثِيَابًا خُضْرًۭا مِّن سُندُسٍۢ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍۢ مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ ۚ نِعْمَ ٱلثَّوَابُ وَحَسُنَتْ مُرْتَفَقًۭا
ar.verse_32: ۞ وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلًۭا رَّجُلَيْنِ جَعَلْنَا لِأَحَدِهِمَا جَنَّتَيْنِ مِنْ أَعْنَٰبٍۢ وَحَفَفْنَٰهُمَا بِنَخْلٍۢ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُمَا زَرْعًۭا
ar.verse_33: كِلْتَا ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ ءَاتَتْ أُكُلَهَا وَلَمْ تَظْلِم مِّنْهُ شَيْـًۭٔا ۚ وَفَجَّرْنَا خِلَٰلَهُمَا نَهَرًۭا
ar.verse_34: وَكَانَ لَهُۥ ثَمَرٌۭ فَقَالَ لِصَٰحِبِهِۦ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَنَا۠ أَكْثَرُ مِنكَ مَالًۭا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرًۭا
ar.verse_35: وَدَخَلَ جَنَّتَهُۥ وَهُوَ ظَالِمٌۭ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ قَالَ مَآ أَظُنُّ أَن تَبِيدَ هَٰذِهِۦٓ أَبَدًۭا
ar.verse_36: وَمَآ أَظُنُّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ قَآئِمَةًۭ وَلَئِن رُّدِدتُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى لَأَجِدَنَّ خَيْرًۭا مِّنْهَا مُنقَلَبًۭا
ar.verse_37: قَالَ لَهُۥ صَاحِبُهُۥ وَهُوَ يُحَاوِرُهُۥٓ أَكَفَرْتَ بِٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ مِن تُرَابٍۢ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ ثُمَّ سَوَّىٰكَ رَجُلًۭا
ar.verse_38: لَّٰكِنَّا۠ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ رَبِّى وَلَآ أُشْرِكُ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًۭا
ar.verse_39: وَلَوْلَآ إِذْ دَخَلْتَ جَنَّتَكَ قُلْتَ مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ إِن تَرَنِ أَنَا۠ أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مَالًۭا وَوَلَدًۭا
ar.verse_40: فَعَسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَن يُؤْتِيَنِ خَيْرًۭا مِّن جَنَّتِكَ وَيُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهَا حُسْبَانًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَتُصْبِحَ صَعِيدًۭا زَلَقًا
ar.verse_41: أَوْ يُصْبِحَ مَآؤُهَا غَوْرًۭا فَلَن تَسْتَطِيعَ لَهُۥ طَلَبًۭا
ar.verse_42: وَأُحِيطَ بِثَمَرِهِۦ فَأَصْبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيْهِ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَنفَقَ فِيهَا وَهِىَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا وَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُشْرِكْ بِرَبِّىٓ أَحَدًۭا
ar.verse_43: وَلَمْ تَكُن لَّهُۥ فِئَةٌۭ يَنصُرُونَهُۥ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا كَانَ مُنتَصِرًا
ar.verse_44: هُنَالِكَ ٱلْوَلَٰيَةُ لِلَّهِ ٱلْحَقِّ ۚ هُوَ خَيْرٌۭ ثَوَابًۭا وَخَيْرٌ عُقْبًۭا
ar.verse_45: وَٱضْرِبْ لَهُم مَّثَلَ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا كَمَآءٍ أَنزَلْنَٰهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَٱخْتَلَطَ بِهِۦ نَبَاتُ ٱلْأَرْضِ فَأَصْبَحَ هَشِيمًۭا تَذْرُوهُ ٱلرِّيَٰحُ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ مُّقْتَدِرًا
ar.verse_46: ٱلْمَالُ وَٱلْبَنُونَ زِينَةُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَٱلْبَٰقِيَٰتُ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًۭا وَخَيْرٌ أَمَلًۭا
ar.verse_47: وَيَوْمَ نُسَيِّرُ ٱلْجِبَالَ وَتَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ بَارِزَةًۭ وَحَشَرْنَٰهُمْ فَلَمْ نُغَادِرْ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًۭا
ar.verse_48: وَعُرِضُوا۟ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ صَفًّۭا لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمُونَا كَمَا خَلَقْنَٰكُمْ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍۭ ۚ بَلْ زَعَمْتُمْ أَلَّن نَّجْعَلَ لَكُم مَّوْعِدًۭا
ar.verse_49: وَوُضِعَ ٱلْكِتَٰبُ فَتَرَى ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ مُشْفِقِينَ مِمَّا فِيهِ وَيَقُولُونَ يَٰوَيْلَتَنَا مَالِ هَٰذَا ٱلْكِتَٰبِ لَا يُغَادِرُ صَغِيرَةًۭ وَلَا كَبِيرَةً إِلَّآ أَحْصَىٰهَا ۚ وَوَجَدُوا۟ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ حَاضِرًۭا ۗ وَلَا يَظْلِمُ رَبُّكَ أَحَدًۭا
ar.verse_50: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِءَادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَفَسَقَ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِۦٓ ۗ أَفَتَتَّخِذُونَهُۥ وَذُرِّيَّتَهُۥٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِى وَهُمْ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۢ ۚ بِئْسَ لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ بَدَلًۭا
ar.verse_51: ۞ مَّآ أَشْهَدتُّهُمْ خَلْقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا خَلْقَ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمَا كُنتُ مُتَّخِذَ ٱلْمُضِلِّينَ عَضُدًۭا
ar.verse_52: وَيَوْمَ يَقُولُ نَادُوا۟ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ زَعَمْتُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَا بَيْنَهُم مَّوْبِقًۭا
ar.verse_53: وَرَءَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ ٱلنَّارَ فَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُم مُّوَاقِعُوهَا وَلَمْ يَجِدُوا۟ عَنْهَا مَصْرِفًۭا
ar.verse_54: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَا فِى هَٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ لِلنَّاسِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍۢ ۚ وَكَانَ ٱلْإِنسَٰنُ أَكْثَرَ شَىْءٍۢ جَدَلًۭا
ar.verse_55: وَمَا مَنَعَ ٱلنَّاسَ أَن يُؤْمِنُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰ وَيَسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن تَأْتِيَهُمْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ قُبُلًۭا
ar.verse_56: وَمَا نُرْسِلُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرِينَ وَمُنذِرِينَ ۚ وَيُجَٰدِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِٱلْبَٰطِلِ لِيُدْحِضُوا۟ بِهِ ٱلْحَقَّ ۖ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَٰتِى وَمَآ أُنذِرُوا۟ هُزُوًۭا
ar.verse_57: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ فَأَعْرَضَ عَنْهَا وَنَسِىَ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ ۚ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ أَكِنَّةً أَن يَفْقَهُوهُ وَفِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَقْرًۭا ۖ وَإِن تَدْعُهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْهُدَىٰ فَلَن يَهْتَدُوٓا۟ إِذًا أَبَدًۭا
ar.verse_58: وَرَبُّكَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ذُو ٱلرَّحْمَةِ ۖ لَوْ يُؤَاخِذُهُم بِمَا كَسَبُوا۟ لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ۚ بَل لَّهُم مَّوْعِدٌۭ لَّن يَجِدُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦ مَوْئِلًۭا
ar.verse_59: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَهْلَكْنَٰهُمْ لَمَّا ظَلَمُوا۟ وَجَعَلْنَا لِمَهْلِكِهِم مَّوْعِدًۭا
ar.verse_60: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِفَتَىٰهُ لَآ أَبْرَحُ حَتَّىٰٓ أَبْلُغَ مَجْمَعَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ أَوْ أَمْضِىَ حُقُبًۭا
ar.verse_61: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَا مَجْمَعَ بَيْنِهِمَا نَسِيَا حُوتَهُمَا فَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ سَرَبًۭا
ar.verse_62: فَلَمَّا جَاوَزَا قَالَ لِفَتَىٰهُ ءَاتِنَا غَدَآءَنَا لَقَدْ لَقِينَا مِن سَفَرِنَا هَٰذَا نَصَبًۭا
ar.verse_63: قَالَ أَرَءَيْتَ إِذْ أَوَيْنَآ إِلَى ٱلصَّخْرَةِ فَإِنِّى نَسِيتُ ٱلْحُوتَ وَمَآ أَنسَىٰنِيهُ إِلَّا ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ أَنْ أَذْكُرَهُۥ ۚ وَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ عَجَبًۭا
ar.verse_64: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنَّا نَبْغِ ۚ فَٱرْتَدَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَارِهِمَا قَصَصًۭا
ar.verse_65: فَوَجَدَا عَبْدًۭا مِّنْ عِبَادِنَآ ءَاتَيْنَٰهُ رَحْمَةًۭ مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَعَلَّمْنَٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّا عِلْمًۭا
ar.verse_66: قَالَ لَهُۥ مُوسَىٰ هَلْ أَتَّبِعُكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تُعَلِّمَنِ مِمَّا عُلِّمْتَ رُشْدًۭا
ar.verse_67: قَالَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًۭا
ar.verse_68: وَكَيْفَ تَصْبِرُ عَلَىٰ مَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ خُبْرًۭا
ar.verse_69: قَالَ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ صَابِرًۭا وَلَآ أَعْصِى لَكَ أَمْرًۭا
ar.verse_70: قَالَ فَإِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَنِى فَلَا تَسْـَٔلْنِى عَن شَىْءٍ حَتَّىٰٓ أُحْدِثَ لَكَ مِنْهُ ذِكْرًۭا
ar.verse_71: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَكِبَا فِى ٱلسَّفِينَةِ خَرَقَهَا ۖ قَالَ أَخَرَقْتَهَا لِتُغْرِقَ أَهْلَهَا لَقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًٔا إِمْرًۭا
ar.verse_72: قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًۭا
ar.verse_73: قَالَ لَا تُؤَاخِذْنِى بِمَا نَسِيتُ وَلَا تُرْهِقْنِى مِنْ أَمْرِى عُسْرًۭا
ar.verse_74: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا لَقِيَا غُلَٰمًۭا فَقَتَلَهُۥ قَالَ أَقَتَلْتَ نَفْسًۭا زَكِيَّةًۢ بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍۢ لَّقَدْ جِئْتَ شَيْـًۭٔا نُّكْرًۭا
ar.verse_75: ۞ قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكَ إِنَّكَ لَن تَسْتَطِيعَ مَعِىَ صَبْرًۭا
ar.verse_76: قَالَ إِن سَأَلْتُكَ عَن شَىْءٍۭ بَعْدَهَا فَلَا تُصَٰحِبْنِى ۖ قَدْ بَلَغْتَ مِن لَّدُنِّى عُذْرًۭا
ar.verse_77: فَٱنطَلَقَا حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَيَآ أَهْلَ قَرْيَةٍ ٱسْتَطْعَمَآ أَهْلَهَا فَأَبَوْا۟ أَن يُضَيِّفُوهُمَا فَوَجَدَا فِيهَا جِدَارًۭا يُرِيدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ فَأَقَامَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ لَوْ شِئْتَ لَتَّخَذْتَ عَلَيْهِ أَجْرًۭا
ar.verse_78: قَالَ هَٰذَا فِرَاقُ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنِكَ ۚ سَأُنَبِّئُكَ بِتَأْوِيلِ مَا لَمْ تَسْتَطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًا
ar.verse_79: أَمَّا ٱلسَّفِينَةُ فَكَانَتْ لِمَسَٰكِينَ يَعْمَلُونَ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ فَأَرَدتُّ أَنْ أَعِيبَهَا وَكَانَ وَرَآءَهُم مَّلِكٌۭ يَأْخُذُ كُلَّ سَفِينَةٍ غَصْبًۭا
ar.verse_80: وَأَمَّا ٱلْغُلَٰمُ فَكَانَ أَبَوَاهُ مُؤْمِنَيْنِ فَخَشِينَآ أَن يُرْهِقَهُمَا طُغْيَٰنًۭا وَكُفْرًۭا
ar.verse_81: فَأَرَدْنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَهُمَا رَبُّهُمَا خَيْرًۭا مِّنْهُ زَكَوٰةًۭ وَأَقْرَبَ رُحْمًۭا
ar.verse_82: وَأَمَّا ٱلْجِدَارُ فَكَانَ لِغُلَٰمَيْنِ يَتِيمَيْنِ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ وَكَانَ تَحْتَهُۥ كَنزٌۭ لَّهُمَا وَكَانَ أَبُوهُمَا صَٰلِحًۭا فَأَرَادَ رَبُّكَ أَن يَبْلُغَآ أَشُدَّهُمَا وَيَسْتَخْرِجَا كَنزَهُمَا رَحْمَةًۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ وَمَا فَعَلْتُهُۥ عَنْ أَمْرِى ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَأْوِيلُ مَا لَمْ تَسْطِع عَّلَيْهِ صَبْرًۭا
ar.verse_83: وَيَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَن ذِى ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ ۖ قُلْ سَأَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكُم مِّنْهُ ذِكْرًا
ar.verse_84: إِنَّا مَكَّنَّا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَءَاتَيْنَٰهُ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ سَبَبًۭا
ar.verse_85: فَأَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
ar.verse_86: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَغْرِبَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَغْرُبُ فِى عَيْنٍ حَمِئَةٍۢ وَوَجَدَ عِندَهَا قَوْمًۭا ۗ قُلْنَا يَٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِمَّآ أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمَّآ أَن تَتَّخِذَ فِيهِمْ حُسْنًۭا
ar.verse_87: قَالَ أَمَّا مَن ظَلَمَ فَسَوْفَ نُعَذِّبُهُۥ ثُمَّ يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ فَيُعَذِّبُهُۥ عَذَابًۭا نُّكْرًۭا
ar.verse_88: وَأَمَّا مَنْ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحًۭا فَلَهُۥ جَزَآءً ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ وَسَنَقُولُ لَهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِنَا يُسْرًۭا
ar.verse_89: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
ar.verse_90: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ مَطْلِعَ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَجَدَهَا تَطْلُعُ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍۢ لَّمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُم مِّن دُونِهَا سِتْرًۭا
ar.verse_91: كَذَٰلِكَ وَقَدْ أَحَطْنَا بِمَا لَدَيْهِ خُبْرًۭا
ar.verse_92: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
ar.verse_93: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ بَيْنَ ٱلسَّدَّيْنِ وَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمَا قَوْمًۭا لَّا يَكَادُونَ يَفْقَهُونَ قَوْلًۭا
ar.verse_94: قَالُوا۟ يَٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِنَّ يَأْجُوجَ وَمَأْجُوجَ مُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَهَلْ نَجْعَلُ لَكَ خَرْجًا عَلَىٰٓ أَن تَجْعَلَ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَهُمْ سَدًّۭا
ar.verse_95: قَالَ مَا مَكَّنِّى فِيهِ رَبِّى خَيْرٌۭ فَأَعِينُونِى بِقُوَّةٍ أَجْعَلْ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُمْ رَدْمًا
ar.verse_96: ءَاتُونِى زُبَرَ ٱلْحَدِيدِ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا سَاوَىٰ بَيْنَ ٱلصَّدَفَيْنِ قَالَ ٱنفُخُوا۟ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَعَلَهُۥ نَارًۭا قَالَ ءَاتُونِىٓ أُفْرِغْ عَلَيْهِ قِطْرًۭا
ar.verse_97: فَمَا ٱسْطَٰعُوٓا۟ أَن يَظْهَرُوهُ وَمَا ٱسْتَطَٰعُوا۟ لَهُۥ نَقْبًۭا
ar.verse_98: قَالَ هَٰذَا رَحْمَةٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى جَعَلَهُۥ دَكَّآءَ ۖ وَكَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى حَقًّۭا
ar.verse_99: ۞ وَتَرَكْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَمُوجُ فِى بَعْضٍۢ ۖ وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَجَمَعْنَٰهُمْ جَمْعًۭا
ar.verse_101: ٱلَّذِينَ كَانَتْ أَعْيُنُهُمْ فِى غِطَآءٍ عَن ذِكْرِى وَكَانُوا۟ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَمْعًا
ar.verse_102: أَفَحَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَن يَتَّخِذُوا۟ عِبَادِى مِن دُونِىٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا جَهَنَّمَ لِلْكَٰفِرِينَ نُزُلًۭا
ar.verse_104: ٱلَّذِينَ ضَلَّ سَعْيُهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ يُحْسِنُونَ صُنْعًا
ar.verse_105: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَلِقَآئِهِۦ فَحَبِطَتْ أَعْمَٰلُهُمْ فَلَا نُقِيمُ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ وَزْنًۭا
ar.verse_106: ذَٰلِكَ جَزَآؤُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ بِمَا كَفَرُوا۟ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَٰتِى وَرُسُلِى هُزُوًا
ar.verse_107: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَنَّٰتُ ٱلْفِرْدَوْسِ نُزُلًا
ar.verse_108: خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يَبْغُونَ عَنْهَا حِوَلًۭا
ar.verse_109: قُل لَّوْ كَانَ ٱلْبَحْرُ مِدَادًۭا لِّكَلِمَٰتِ رَبِّى لَنَفِدَ ٱلْبَحْرُ قَبْلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِمَٰتُ رَبِّى وَلَوْ جِئْنَا بِمِثْلِهِۦ مَدَدًۭا
ar.verse_110: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ أَنَّمَآ إِلَٰهُكُمْ إِلَٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ ۖ فَمَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ لِقَآءَ رَبِّهِۦ فَلْيَعْمَلْ عَمَلًۭا صَٰلِحًۭا وَلَا يُشْرِكْ بِعِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ أَحَدًۢا

fr.verse_0: Au nom d'Allah, le Tout Miséricordieux, le Très Miséricordieux.
fr.verse_1: Louange à Allah qui a fait descendre sur Son serviteur (Muhammad), le Livre, et n'y a point introduit de tortuosité (ambiguité)!
fr.verse_2: [Un Livre] d'une parfaite droiture pour avertir d'une sévère punition venant de Sa part et pour annoncer aux croyants qui font de bonnes œuvres qu'il y aura pour eux une belle récompense.
fr.verse_3: où ils demeureront éternellement,
fr.verse_4: et pour avertir ceux qui disent: «Allah S'est attribué un enfant.»
fr.verse_5: Ni eux ni leurs ancêtres n'en savent rien. Quelle monstrueuse parole que celle qui sort de leurs bouches! Ce qu'ils disent n'est que mensonge.
fr.verse_6: Tu vas peut-être te consumer de chagrin parce qu'ils se détournent de toi et ne croient pas en ce discours!
fr.verse_7: Nous avons placé ce qu'il y a sur la terre pour l'embellir, afin d'éprouver (les hommes et afin de savoir) qui d'entre eux sont les meilleurs dans leurs actions.
fr.verse_8: Puis, Nous allons sûrement transformer sa surface en un sol aride.
fr.verse_9: Penses-tu que les gens de la Caverne et d'ar-Raquîm ont constitué une chose extraordinaire d'entre Nos prodiges?
fr.verse_10: Quand les jeunes gens se furent réfugiés dans la caverne, ils dirent: «O notre Seigneur, donne-nous de Ta part une miséricorde; et assure nous la droiture dans tout ce qui nous concerne».
fr.verse_11: Alors, Nous avons assourdi leurs oreilles, dans la caverne pendant de nombreuses années.
fr.verse_12: Ensuite, Nous les avons ressuscités, afin de savoir lequel des deux groupes saurait le mieux calculer la durée exacte de leur séjour.
fr.verse_13: Nous allons te raconter leur récit en toute vérité. Ce sont des jeunes gens qui croyaient en leur Seigneur; et Nous leur avons accordé les plus grands moyens de se diriger [dans la bonne voie].
fr.verse_14: Nous avons fortifié leurs cœurs lorsqu'ils s'étaient levés pour dire: «Notre Seigneur est le Seigneur des cieux et de la terre: jamais nous n'invoquerons de divinité en dehors de Lui, sans quoi, nous transgresserions dans nos paroles.
fr.verse_15: Voilà que nos concitoyens ont adopté en dehors de Lui des divinités. Que n'apportent-ils sur elles une preuve évidente? Quel pire injuste, donc que celui qui invente un mensonge contre Allah?
fr.verse_16: Et quand vous vous serez séparés d'eux et de ce qu'ils adorent en dehors d'Allah, réfugiez-vous donc dans la caverne: votre Seigneur répandra de Sa miséricorde sur vous et disposera pour vous un adoucissement à votre sort.
fr.verse_17: Tu aurais vu le soleil, quand il se lève, s'écarter de leur caverne vers la droite, et quand il se couche, passer à leur gauche, tandis qu'eux-mêmes sont là dans une partie spacieuse (de la caverne)... Cela est une des merveilles d'Allah. Celui qu'Allah guide, c'est lui le bien-guidé. Et quiconque Il égare, tu ne trouveras alors pour lui aucun allié pour le mettre sur la bonne voie.
fr.verse_18: Et tu les aurais cru éveillés, alors qu'ils dorment. Et Nous les tournons sur le côté droit et sur le côté gauche, tandis que leur chien est à l'entrée, pattes étendues. Si tu les avais aperçus, certes tu leur aurais tourné le dos en fuyant; et tu aurais été assurément rempli d'effroi devant eux.
fr.verse_19: Et c'est ainsi que Nous les ressuscitâmes, afin qu'ils s'interrogent entre eux. L'un parmi eux dit: «Combien de temps avez-vous demeuré là?» Ils dirent: «Nous avons demeuré un jour ou une partie d'un jour». D'autres dirent: «Votre Seigneur sait mieux combien [de temps] vous y avez demeuré. Envoyez donc l'un de vous à la ville avec votre argent que voici, pour qu'il voie quel aliment est le plus pur et qu'il vous en apporte de quoi vous nourrir. Qu'il agisse avec tact; et qu'il ne donne l'éveil à personne sur vous.
fr.verse_20: Si jamais ils vous attrapent, ils vous lapideront ou vous feront retourner à leur religion, et vous ne réussirez alors plus jamais».
fr.verse_21: Et c'est ainsi que Nous fîmes qu'ils furent découverts, afin qu'ils [les gens de la cité] sachent que la promesse d'Allah est vérité et qu'il n'y ait point de doute au sujet de l'Heure. Aussi se disputèrent-ils à leur sujet et déclarèrent-ils: «Construisez sur eux un édifice. Leur Seigneur les connaît mieux». Mais ceux qui l'emportèrent [dans la discussion] dirent: «Elevons sur eux un sanctuaire».
fr.verse_22: Ils diront: «ils étaient trois et le quatrième était leur chien». Et ils diront en conjecturant sur leur mystère qu'ils étaient cinq, le sixième étant leur chien et ils diront: «sept, le huitième étant leur chien». Dis: «Mon Seigneur connaît mieux leur nombre. Il n'en est que peu qui le savent». Ne discute à leur sujet que d'une façon apparente et ne consulte personne en ce qui les concerne.
fr.verse_23: Et ne dis jamais, à propos d'une chose: «Je la ferai sûrement demain»,
fr.verse_24: sans ajouter: «Si Allah le veut», et invoque ton Seigneur quand tu oublies et dis: «Je souhaite que mon Seigneur me guide et me mène plus près de ce qui est correct».
fr.verse_25: Or, ils demeurèrent dans leur caverne trois cents ans et en ajoutèrent neuf (années).
fr.verse_26: Dis: «Allah sait mieux combien de temps ils demeurèrent là. A Lui appartient l'Inconnaissable des cieux et de la terre. Comme Il est Voyant et Audient! Ils n'ont aucun allié en dehors de Lui et Il n'associe personne à Son commandement.
fr.verse_27: Et récite ce qui t'a été révélé du Livre de ton Seigneur. Nul ne peut changer Ses paroles. Et tu ne trouveras, en dehors de Lui, aucun refuge.
fr.verse_28: Fais preuve de patience [en restant] avec ceux qui invoquent leur Seigneur matin et soir, désirant Sa Face. Et que tes yeux ne se détachent point d'eux, en cherchant (le faux) brillant de la vie sur terre. Et n'obéis pas à celui dont Nous avons rendu le cœur inattentif à Notre Rappel, qui poursuit sa passion et dont le comportement est outrancier.
fr.verse_29: Et dis: «La vérité émane de votre Seigneur». Quiconque le veut, qu'il croie, quiconque le veut qu'il mécroie». Nous avons préparé pour les injustes un Feu dont les flammes les cernent. Et s'ils implorent à boire on les abreuvera d'une eau comme du métal fondu brûlant les visages. Quelle mauvaise boisson et quelle détestable demeure!
fr.verse_30: Ceux qui croient et font de bonnes œuvres... vraiment Nous ne laissons pas perdre la récompense de celui qui fait le bien.
fr.verse_31: Voilà ceux qui auront les jardins du séjour (éternel) sous lesquels coulent les ruisseaux. Ils y seront parés de bracelets d'or et se vêtiront d'habits verts de soie fine et de brocart, accoudés sur des divans (bien ornés). Quelle bonne récompense et quelle belle demeure!
fr.verse_32: Donne-leur l'exemple de deux hommes: à l'un d'eux Nous avons assigné deux jardins de vignes que Nous avons entourés de palmiers et Nous avons mis entre les deux jardins des champs cultivés.
fr.verse_33: Les deux jardins produisaient leur récolte sans jamais manquer. Et Nous avons fait jaillir entre eux un ruisseau.
fr.verse_34: Et il avait des fruits et dit alors à son compagnon avec qui il conversait: «Je possède plus de biens que toi, et je suis plus puissant que toi grâce à mon clan».
fr.verse_35: Il entra dans son jardin coupable envers lui-même [par sa mécréance]; il dit: «Je ne pense pas que ceci puisse jamais périr,
fr.verse_36: et je ne pense pas que l'Heure viendra. Et si on me ramène vers mon Seigneur, je trouverai certes meilleur lieu de retour que ce jardin.
fr.verse_37: Son compagnon lui dit, tout en conversant avec lui: «Serais-tu mécréant envers Celui qui t'a créé de terre, puis de sperme et enfin t'a façonné en homme?
fr.verse_38: Quant à moi, c'est Allah qui est mon Seigneur; et je n'associe personne à mon Seigneur.
fr.verse_39: En entrant dans ton jardin, que ne dis-tu: «Telle est la volonté (et la grâce) d'Allah! Il n'y a de puissance que par Allah». Si tu me vois moins pourvu que toi en biens et en enfants,
fr.verse_40: il se peut que mon Seigneur, bientôt, me donne quelque chose de meilleur que ton jardin, qu'Il envoie sur [ce dernier], du ciel, quelque calamité, et que son sol devienne glissant,
fr.verse_41: ou que son eau tarisse de sorte que tu ne puisses plus la retrouver».
fr.verse_42: Et sa récolte fut détruite et il se mit alors à se tordre les deux mains à cause de ce qu'il y avait dépensé, cependant que ses treilles étaient complètement ravagées. Et il disait: «Que je souhaite n'avoir associé personne à mon Seigneur!»
fr.verse_43: Il n'eut aucun groupe de gens pour le secourir contre (la punition) d'Allah. Et il ne put se secourir lui-même.
fr.verse_44: En l'occurrence, la souveraine protection appartient à Allah, le Vrai. Il accorde la meilleure récompense et le meilleur résultat.
fr.verse_45: Et propose-leur l'exemple de la vie ici-bas. Elle est semblable à une eau que Nous faisons descendre du ciel; la végétation de la terre se mélange à elle. Puis elle devient de l'herbe desséchée que les vents dispersent. Allah est certes Puissant en toutes choses!
fr.verse_46: Les biens et les enfants sont l'ornement de la vie de ce monde. Cependant, les bonnes œuvres qui persistent ont auprès de ton Seigneur une meilleure récompense et [suscitent] une belle espérance.
fr.verse_47: Le jour où Nous ferons marcher les montagnes et où tu verras la terre nivelée (comme une plaine) et Nous les rassemblerons sans en omettre un seul.
fr.verse_48: Et ils seront présentés en rangs devant ton Seigneur. «Vous voilà venus à Nous comme Nous vous avons créés la première fois. Pourtant vous prétendiez que Nous ne remplirions pas Nos promesses».
fr.verse_49: Et on déposera le livre (de chacun). Alors tu verras les criminels, effrayés à cause de ce qu'il y a dedans, dire: «Malheur à nous, qu'a donc ce livre à n'omettre de mentionner ni péché véniel ni péché capital?» Et ils trouveront devant eux tout ce qu'ils ont œuvré. Et ton Seigneur ne fait du tort à personne.
fr.verse_50: Et lorsque nous dîmes aux Anges: «Prosternez-vous devant Adam», ils se prosternèrent, excepté Iblis [Satan] qui était du nombre des djinns et qui se révolta contre le commandement de son Seigneur. Allez-vous cependant le prendre, ainsi que sa descendance, pour alliés en dehors de Moi, alors qu'ils vous sont ennemis? Quel mauvais échange pour les injustes!
fr.verse_51: Je ne les ai pas pris comme témoins de la création des cieux et de la terre, ni de la création de leurs propres personnes. Et Je n'ai pas pris comme aides ceux qui égarent.
fr.verse_52: Et le jour où Il dira: «Appelez ceux que vous prétendiez être Mes associés». Ils les invoqueront; mais eux ne leur répondront pas, Nous aurons placé entre eux une vallée de perdition.
fr.verse_53: Et les criminels verront le Feu. Ils seront alors convaincus qu'ils y tomberont et n'en trouveront pas d'échappatoire.
fr.verse_54: Et assurément, Nous avons déployé pour les gens, dans ce Coran, toutes sortes d'exemples. L'homme cependant, est de tous les êtres le plus grand disputeur.
fr.verse_55: Qu'est-ce qui a donc empêché les gens de croire, lorsque le guide leur est venu, ainsi que de demander pardon à leur Seigneur, si ce n'est qu'ils veulent subir le sort des Anciens, ou se trouver face à face avec le châtiment.
fr.verse_56: Et Nous n'envoyons des messagers que pour annoncer la bonne nouvelle et avertir. Et ceux qui ont mécru disputent avec de faux arguments, afin d'infirmer la vérité et prennent en raillerie Mes versets (le Coran) ainsi que ce (châtiment) dont on les a avertis.
fr.verse_57: Quel pire injuste que celui à qui on a rappelé les versets de son Seigneur et qui en détourna le dos en oubliant ce que ses deux mains ont commis? Nous avons placé des voiles sur leurs cœurs, de sorte qu'ils ne comprennent pas (le Coran), et mis une lourdeur dans leurs oreilles. Même si tu les appelles vers la bonne voie, jamais ils ne pourront donc se guider.
fr.verse_58: Et ton Seigneur est le Pardonneur, le Détenteur de la miséricorde. S'Il s'en prenait à eux pour ce qu'ils ont acquis, Il leur hâterait certes le châtiment. Mais il y a pour eux un terme fixé (pour l'accomplissement des menaces) contre lequel ils ne trouveront aucun refuge.
fr.verse_59: Et voilà les villes que Nous avons fait périr quand leurs peuples commirent des injustices et Nous avons fixé un rendez-vous pour leur destruction.
fr.verse_60: (Rappelle-toi) quand Moïse dit à son valet: «Je n'arrêterai pas avant d'avoir atteint le confluent des deux mers, dussé-je marcher de longues années».
fr.verse_61: Puis, lorsque tous deux eurent atteint le confluent, Ils oublièrent leur poisson qui prit alors librement son chemin dans la mer.
fr.verse_62: Puis, lorsque tous deux eurent dépassé [cet endroit,] il dit à son valet: «Apporte-nous notre déjeuner: nous avons rencontré de la fatigue dans notre présent voyage».
fr.verse_63: [Le valet lui] dit: «Quand nous avons pris refuge près du rocher, vois-tu, j'ai oublié le poisson - le Diable seul m'a fait oublier de (te) le rappeler - et il a curieusement pris son chemin dans la mer».
fr.verse_64: [Moïse] dit: «Voilà ce que nous cherchions». Puis, ils retournèrent sur leurs pas, suivant leurs traces.
fr.verse_65: Ils trouvèrent l'un de Nos serviteurs à qui Nous avions donné une grâce, de Notre part, et à qui Nous avions enseigné une science émanant de Nous.
fr.verse_66: Moïse lui dit: «Puis-je te suivre, à la condition que tu m'apprennes de ce qu'on t'a appris concernant une bonne direction?»
fr.verse_67: [L'autre] dit: «Vraiment, tu ne pourras jamais être patient avec moi.
fr.verse_68: Comment endurerais-tu sur des choses que tu n'embrasses pas par ta connaissance?»
fr.verse_69: [Moïse] lui dit: «Si Allah veut, tu me trouveras patient; et je ne désobéirai à aucun de tes ordres».
fr.verse_70: «Si tu me suis, dit [l'autre,] ne m'interroge sur rien tant que je ne t'en aurai pas fait mention».
fr.verse_71: Alors les deux partirent. Et après qu'ils furent montés sur un bateau, l'homme y fit une brèche. [Moïse] lui dit: «Est-ce pour noyer ses occupants que tu l'as ébréché? Tu as commis, certes, une chose monstrueuse!»
fr.verse_72: [L'autre] répondit: «N'ai-je pas dit que tu ne pourrais pas garder patience en ma compagnie?»
fr.verse_73: «Ne t'en prends pas à moi, dit [Moïse,] pour un oubli de ma part; et ne m'impose pas de grande difficulté dans mon affaire».
fr.verse_74: Puis ils partirent tous deux; et quand ils eurent rencontré un enfant, [l'homme] le tua. Alors [Moïse] lui dit: «As-tu tué un être innocent, qui n'a tué personne? Tu as commis certes, une chose affreuse!»
fr.verse_75: [L'autre] lui dit: «Ne t'ai je pas dit que tu ne pourrais pas garder patience en ma compagnie?»
fr.verse_76: «Si, après cela, je t'interroge sur quoi que ce soit, dit [Moïse], alors ne m'accompagne plus. Tu seras alors excusé de te séparer de moi».
fr.verse_77: Ils partirent donc tous deux; et quand ils furent arrivés à un village habité, ils demandèrent à manger à ses habitants; mais ceux-ci refusèrent de leur donner l'hospitalité. Ensuite, ils y trouvèrent un mur sur le point de s'écrouler. L'homme le redressa. Alors [Moïse] lui dit: «Si tu voulais, tu aurais bien pu réclamer pour cela un salaire».
fr.verse_78: «Ceci [marque] la séparation entre toi et moi, dit [l'homme,] Je vais t'apprendre l'interprétation de ce que tu n'as pu supporter avec patience.
fr.verse_79: Pour ce qui est du bateau, il appartenait à des pauvres gens qui travaillaient en mer. Je voulais donc le rendre défectueux, car il y avait derrière eux un roi qui saisissait de force tout bateau.
fr.verse_80: Quant au garçon, ses père et mère étaient des croyants; nous avons craint qu'il ne leur imposât la rébellion et la mécréance.
fr.verse_81: Nous avons donc voulu que leur Seigneur leur accordât en échange un autre plus pur et plus affectueux.
fr.verse_82: Et quant au mur, il appartenait à deux garçons orphelins de la ville, et il y avait dessous un trésor à eux; et leur père était un homme vertueux. Ton Seigneur a donc voulu que tous deux atteignent leur maturité et qu'ils extraient, [eux-mêmes] leur trésor, par une miséricorde de ton Seigneur. Je ne l'ai d'ailleurs pas fait de mon propre chef. Voilà l'interprétation de ce que tu n'as pas pu endurer avec patience».
fr.verse_83: Et ils t'interrogent sur Dûl-Qarnayn. Dis: «Je vais vous en citer quelque fait mémorable».
fr.verse_84: Vraiment, Nous avons affermi sa puissance sur terre, et Nous lui avons donné libre voie à toute chose.
fr.verse_85: Il suivit donc une voie.
fr.verse_86: Et quand il eut atteint le Couchant, il trouva que le soleil se couchait dans une source boueuse, et, auprès d'elle il trouva une peuplade [impie]. Nous dîmes: «O Dûl-Qarnayn! ou tu les châties, ou tu uses de bienveillance à leur égard».
fr.verse_87: Il dit: «Quant à celui qui est injuste, nous le châtierons; ensuite il sera ramené vers son Seigneur qui le punira d'un châtiment terrible.
fr.verse_88: Et quant à celui qui croit et fait bonne œuvre, il aura, en retour, la plus belle récompense. Et nous lui donnerons des ordres faciles à exécuter».
fr.verse_89: Puis, il suivit (une autre) voie.
fr.verse_90: Et quand il eut atteint le Levant, il trouva que le soleil se levait sur une peuplade à laquelle Nous n'avions pas donné de voile pour s'en protéger.
fr.verse_91: Il en fut ainsi et Nous embrassons de Notre Science ce qu'il détenait.
fr.verse_92: Puis, il suivit (une autre) voie.
fr.verse_93: Et quand il eut atteint un endroit situé entre les Deux Barrières (montagnes), il trouva derrière elles une peuplade qui ne comprenait presque aucun langage.
fr.verse_94: Ils dirent: «O Dûl-Qarnayn, les Yâ jûj et les Mâ jûj commettent du désordre sur terre. Est-ce que nous pourrons t'accorder un tribut pour construire une barrière entre eux et nous?»
fr.verse_95: Il dit: «Ce que Mon Seigneur m'a conféré vaut mieux (que vos dons). Aidez-moi donc avec votre force et je construirai un remblai entre vous et eux.
fr.verse_96: Apportez-moi des blocs de fer». Puis, lorsqu'il en eut comblé l'espace entre les deux montagnes, il dit: «Soufflez!» Puis, lorsqu'il l'eut rendu une fournaise, il dit: «Apportez-moi du cuivre fondu, que je le déverse dessus».
fr.verse_97: Ainsi, ils ne purent guère l'escalader ni l'ébrécher non plus.
fr.verse_98: Il dit: «C'est une miséricorde de la part de mon Seigneur. Mais, lorsque la promesse de mon Seigneur viendra, Il le nivellera. Et la promesse de mon Seigneur est vérité».
fr.verse_99: Nous les laisserons, ce jour-là, déferler comme les flots les uns sur les autres, et on soufflera dans la Trompe et Nous les rassemblerons tous.
fr.verse_100: Et ce jour-là Nous présenterons de près l'Enfer aux mécréants,
fr.verse_101: dont les yeux étaient couverts d'un voile qui les empêchait de penser à Moi, et ils ne pouvaient rien entendre non plus.
fr.verse_102: Ceux qui ont mécru, comptent-ils donc pouvoir prendre, pour alliés, Mes serviteurs en dehors de Moi? Nous avons préparé l'Enfer comme résidence pour les mécréants.
fr.verse_103: Dis: «Voulez-vous que Nous vous apprenions lesquels sont les plus grands perdants, en œuvres?
fr.verse_104: Ceux dont l'effort, dans la vie présente, s'est égaré, alors qu'ils s'imaginent faire le bien.
fr.verse_105: Ceux-là qui ont nié les signes de leur Seigneur, ainsi que Sa rencontre. Leurs actions sont donc vaines». Nous ne leur assignerons pas de poids au Jour de la Résurrection.
fr.verse_106: C'est que leur rétribution sera l'Enfer, pour avoir mécru et pris en raillerie Mes signes (enseignements) et Mes messagers.
fr.verse_107: Ceux qui croient et font de bonnes œuvres auront pour résidence les Jardins du «Firdaws,» (Paradis),
fr.verse_108: où ils demeureront éternellement, sans désirer aucun changement.
fr.verse_109: Dis: «Si la mer était une encre [pour écrire] les paroles de mon Seigneur, certes la mer s'épuiserait avant que ne soient épuisées les paroles de mon Seigneur, quand même Nous lui apporterions son équivalent comme renfort.»
fr.verse_110: Dis: «Je suis en fait un être humain comme vous. Il m'a été révélé que votre Dieu est un Dieu unique! Quiconque, donc, espère rencontrer son Seigneur, qu'il fasse de bonnes actions et qu'il n'associe dans son adoration aucun autre à son Seigneur».

en.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
en.verse_1: Praise be to God, who revealed the Book to His servant, and allowed in it no distortion.
en.verse_2: Valuable-to warn of severe punishment from Himself; and to deliver good news to the believers who do righteous deeds, that they will have an excellent reward.
en.verse_3: In which they will abide forever.
en.verse_4: And to warn those who say, "God has begotten a son."
en.verse_5: They have no knowledge of this, nor did their forefathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths. They say nothing but a lie.
en.verse_6: Perhaps you may destroy yourself with grief, chasing after them, if they do not believe in this information.
en.verse_7: We made what is upon the earth an ornament for it, to test them as to which of them is best in conduct.
en.verse_8: And We will turn what is on it into barren waste.
en.verse_9: Did you know that the People of the Cave and the Inscription were of Our wondrous signs?
en.verse_10: When the youths took shelter in the cave, they said, "Our Lord, give us mercy from Yourself, and bless our affair with guidance."
en.verse_11: Then We sealed their ears in the cave for a number of years.
en.verse_12: Then We awakened them to know which of the two groups could better calculate the length of their stay.
en.verse_13: We relate to you their story in truth. They were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
en.verse_14: And We strengthened their hearts, when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth; we will not call on any god besides Him, for then we would have spoken an outrage."
en.verse_15: "These people, our people, have taken to themselves gods other than Him. Why do they not bring a clear proof concerning them? Who, then, does greater wrong than he who invents lies and attributes them to God?"
en.verse_16: "Now that you have withdrawn from them, and from what they worship besides God, take shelter in the cave. And your Lord will unfold His mercy for you, and will set your affair towards ease."
en.verse_17: You would have seen the sun, when it rose, veering away from their cave towards the right, and when it sets, moving away from them to the left, as they lay in the midst of the cave. That was one of God's wonders. He whom God guides is truly guided; but he whom He misguides, for him you will find no directing friend.
en.verse_18: You would think them awake, although they were asleep. And We turned them over to the right, and to the left, with their dog stretching its paws across the threshold. Had you looked at them, you would have turned away from them in flight, and been filled with fear of them.
en.verse_19: Even so, We awakened them, so that they may ask one another. A speaker among them said, "How long have you stayed?" They said, "We have stayed a day, or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord knows best how long you have stayed." "Send one of you to the city, with this money of yours, and let him see which food is most suitable, and let him bring you some provision thereof. And let him be gentle, and let no one become aware of you."
en.verse_20: "If they discover you, they will stone you, or force you back into their religion; then you will never be saved."
en.verse_21: So it was, that We caused them to be discovered, that they would know that the promise of God is true, and that of the Hour there is no doubt. As they were disputing their case among themselves, they said, "Build over them a building." Their Lord knows best about them. Those who prevailed over their case said, "We will set up over them a place of worship."
en.verse_22: They will say, "Three, and their fourth being their dog." And they will say, "Five, and their sixth being their dog," guessing at the unknown. And they will say, "Seven, and their eighth being their dog." Say, "My Lord knows best their number." None knows them except a few. So do not argue concerning them except with an obvious argument, and do not consult any of them about them.
en.verse_23: And never say about anything, "I will do that tomorrow."
en.verse_24: Without saying, "If God wills." And remember your Lord if you forget, and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to nearer than this in integrity."
en.verse_25: And they stayed in their cave for three hundred years, adding nine.
en.verse_26: Say, "God knows best how long they stayed." His is the mystery of the heavens and the earth. By Him you see and hear. They have no guardian apart from Him, and He shares His Sovereignty with no one.
en.verse_27: And recite what was revealed to you from the Book of your Lord. There is no changing His words, and you will find no refuge except in Him.
en.verse_28: And content yourself with those who pray to their Lord morning and evening, desiring His Presence. And do not turn your eyes away from them, desiring the glitter of this world. And do not obey him whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance-so he follows his own desires-and his priorities are confused.
en.verse_29: And say, "The truth is from your Lord. Whoever wills-let him believe. And whoever wills-let him disbelieve". We have prepared for the unjust a Fire, whose curtains will hem them in. And when they cry for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass, which scalds the faces. What a miserable drink, and what a terrible place.
en.verse_30: As for those who believe and lead a righteous life-We will not waste the reward of those who work righteousness.
en.verse_31: These will have the Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers flow. Reclining on comfortable furnishings, they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, and will wear green garments of silk and brocade. What a wonderful reward, and what an excellent resting-place.
en.verse_32: And cite for them the parable of two men. To one of them We gave two gardens of vine, and We surrounded them with palms-trees, and We placed between them crops.
en.verse_33: Both gardens produced their harvest in full, and suffered no loss. And We made a river flow through them.
en.verse_34: And thus he had abundant fruits. He said to his friend, as he conversed with him, "I am wealthier than you, and greater in manpower."
en.verse_35: And he entered his garden, wronging himself. He said, "I do not think this will ever perish."
en.verse_36: "And I do not think the Hour is coming. And even if I am returned to my Lord, I will find something better than this in return."
en.verse_37: His friend said to him, as he conversed with him, "Are you being ungrateful to Him who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then evolved you into a man?
en.verse_38: But as for me, He is God, my Lord, and I never associate with my Lord anyone.
en.verse_39: When you entered your garden, why did you not say, "As God wills; there is no power except through God"? Although you see me inferior to you in wealth and children.
en.verse_40: Perhaps my Lord will give me something better than your garden, and release upon it thunderbolts from the sky, so it becomes barren waste.
en.verse_41: Or its water will sink into the ground, and you will be unable to draw it."
en.verse_42: And ruin closed in on his crops, and so he began wringing his hands over what he had invested in it, as it lays fallen upon its trellises. And he was saying, "I wish I never associated anyone with my Lord."
en.verse_43: He had no faction to help him besides God, and he was helpless.
en.verse_44: That is because authority belongs to God, the True. He is Best in rewarding, and Best in requiting.
en.verse_45: And cite for them the parable of the present life: it is like water that We send down from the sky; the plants of the earth absorb it; but then it becomes debris, scattered by the wind. God has absolute power over everything.
en.verse_46: Wealth and children are the adornments of the present life. But the things that last, the virtuous deeds, are better with your Lord for reward, and better for hope.
en.verse_47: On the Day when We set the mountains in motion; and you see the earth emerging; and We gather them together, and leave none of them behind.
en.verse_48: They will be presented before your Lord in a row. "You have come to Us as We created you the first time. Although you claimed We would not set a meeting for you."
en.verse_49: And the book will be placed, and you will see the sinners fearful of its contents. And they will say, "Woe to us! What is with this book that leaves nothing, small or big, but it has enumerated it?" They will find everything they had done present. Your Lord does not wrong anyone.
en.verse_50: We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam." So they bowed down, except for Satan. He was of the jinn, and he defied the command of his Lord. Will you take him and his offspring as lords instead of Me, when they are an enemy to you? Evil is the exchange for the wrongdoers.
en.verse_51: I did not call them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation; and I do not take the misleaders for assistants.
en.verse_52: On the Day when He will say, "Call on My partners whom you have claimed." They will call on them, but they will not answer them. And We will place between them a barrier.
en.verse_53: And the sinners will see the Fire, and will realize that they will tumble into it. They will find no deliverance from it.
en.verse_54: We have elaborated in this Quran for the people every kind of example, but the human being is a most argumentative being.
en.verse_55: What prevented people from accepting faith, when guidance has come to them, and from seeking their Lord's forgiveness? Unless they are waiting for the precedent of the ancients to befall them, or to have the punishment come upon them face to face.
en.verse_56: We send the messengers only as deliverers of good news and warners. Those who disbelieve argue with false argument, in order to defeat the truth thereby. They take My Verses, and the warnings, for a joke.
en.verse_57: Who does greater wrong than he, who, when reminded of his Lord's revelations, turns away from them, and forgets what his hands have put forward? We have placed coverings over their hearts, lest they understand it, and heaviness in their ears. And if you call them to guidance, they will not be guided, ever.
en.verse_58: Your Lord is the Forgiver, Possessor of Mercy. Were He to call them to account for what they have earned, He would have hastened the punishment for them. But they have an appointment from which they will find no escape.
en.verse_59: And these towns-We destroyed them when they committed injustices, and We set for their destruction an appointed time.
en.verse_60: Recall when Moses said to his servant, "I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two rivers, even if it takes me years."
en.verse_61: Then, when they reached the junction between them, they forgot about their fish. It found its way into the river, slipping away.
en.verse_62: When they went further, he said to his servant, "Bring us our lunch; we were exposed in our travel to much fatigue."
en.verse_63: He said, "Do you remember when we rested by the rock? I forgot about the fish. It was only the devil who made me forget it. And so it found its way to the river, amazingly."
en.verse_64: He said, "This is what we were seeking." And so they turned back retracing their steps.
en.verse_65: Then they came upon a servant of Ours, whom We had blessed with mercy from Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our Own.
en.verse_66: Moses said to him, "May I follow you, so that you may teach me some of the guidance you were taught?"
en.verse_67: He said, "You will not be able to endure with me.
en.verse_68: And how will you endure what you have no knowledge of?"
en.verse_69: He said, "You will find me, God willing, patient; and I will not disobey you in any order of yours."
en.verse_70: He said, "If you follow me, do not ask me about anything, until I myself make mention of it to you."
en.verse_71: So they set out. Until, when they had boarded the boat, he holed it. He said, "Did you hole it, to drown its passengers? You have done something awful."
en.verse_72: He said, "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?"
en.verse_73: He said, "Do not rebuke me for forgetting, and do not make my course difficult for me."
en.verse_74: Then they set out. Until, when they encountered a boy, he killed him. He said, "Did you kill a pure soul, who killed no one? You have done something terrible."
en.verse_75: He said, "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?"
en.verse_76: He said, "If I ask you about anything after this, then do not keep company with me. You have received excuses from me."
en.verse_77: So they set out. Until, when they reached the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. There they found a wall about to collapse, and he repaired it. He said, "If you wanted, you could have obtained a payment for it."
en.verse_78: He said, "This is the parting between you and me. I will tell you the interpretation of what you were unable to endure.
en.verse_79: As for the boat, it belonged to paupers working at sea. I wanted to damage it because there was a king coming after them seizing every boat by force.
en.verse_80: As for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared he would overwhelm them with oppression and disbelief.
en.verse_81: So we wanted their Lord to replace him with someone better in purity, and closer to mercy.
en.verse_82: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphaned boys in the town. Beneath it was a treasure that belonged to them. Their father was a righteous man. Your Lord wanted them to reach their maturity, and then extract their treasure-as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it of my own accord. This is the interpretation of what you were unable to endure."
en.verse_83: And they ask you about Zul-Qarnain. Say, "I will tell you something about him."
en.verse_84: We established him on earth, and gave him all kinds of means.
en.verse_85: He pursued a certain course.
en.verse_86: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it setting in a murky spring, and found a people in its vicinity. We said, "O Zul-Qarnain, you may either inflict a penalty, or else treat them kindly."
en.verse_87: He said, "As for him who does wrong, we will penalize him, then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with an unheard-of torment.
en.verse_88: "But as for him who believes and acts righteously, he will have the finest reward, and We will speak to him of Our command with ease."
en.verse_89: Then he pursued a course.
en.verse_90: Until, when he reached the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no shelter from it.
en.verse_91: And so it was. We had full knowledge of what he had.
en.verse_92: Then he pursued a course.
en.verse_93: Until, when he reached the point separating the two barriers, he found beside them a people who could barely understand what is said.
en.verse_94: They said, "O Zul-Qarnain, the Gog and Magog are spreading chaos in the land. Can we pay you, to build between us and them a wall?"
en.verse_95: He said, "What my Lord has empowered me with is better. But assist me with strength, and I will build between you and them a dam."
en.verse_96: "Bring me blocks of iron." So that, when he had leveled up between the two cliffs, he said, "Blow." And having turned it into a fire, he said, "Bring me tar to pour over it."
en.verse_97: So they were unable to climb it, and they could not penetrate it.
en.verse_98: He said, "This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes true, He will turn it into rubble, and the promise of my Lord is always true."
en.verse_99: On that Day, We will leave them surging upon one another. And the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather them together.
en.verse_100: On that Day, We will present the disbelievers to Hell, all displayed.
en.verse_101: Those whose eyes were screened to My message, and were unable to hear.
en.verse_102: Do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants for masters instead of Me? We have prepared Hell for the hospitality of the faithless.
en.verse_103: Say, "Shall We inform you of the greatest losers in their works?"
en.verse_104: "Those whose efforts in this world are misguided, while they assume that they are doing well."
en.verse_105: It is they who rejected the communications of their Lord, and the encounter with Him. So their works are in vain. And on the Day of Resurrection, We will consider them of no weight.
en.verse_106: That is their requital-Hell-on account of their disbelief, and their taking My revelations and My messengers in mockery.
en.verse_107: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, they will have the Gardens of Paradise for hospitality.
en.verse_108: Abiding therein forever, without desiring any change therefrom.
en.verse_109: Say, "If the ocean were ink for the words of my Lord, the ocean would run out, before the words of my Lord run out," even if We were to bring the like of it in addition to it.
en.verse_110: Say, "I am only a human being like you, being inspired that your god is One God. Whoever hopes to meet his Lord, let him work righteousness, and never associate anyone with the service of his Lord."

ar.verse_3: إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ نِدَآءً خَفِيًّۭا
ar.verse_4: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى وَهَنَ ٱلْعَظْمُ مِنِّى وَٱشْتَعَلَ ٱلرَّأْسُ شَيْبًۭا وَلَمْ أَكُنۢ بِدُعَآئِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيًّۭا
ar.verse_5: وَإِنِّى خِفْتُ ٱلْمَوَٰلِىَ مِن وَرَآءِى وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًۭا فَهَبْ لِى مِن لَّدُنكَ وَلِيًّۭا
ar.verse_6: يَرِثُنِى وَيَرِثُ مِنْ ءَالِ يَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَٱجْعَلْهُ رَبِّ رَضِيًّۭا
ar.verse_7: يَٰزَكَرِيَّآ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَٰمٍ ٱسْمُهُۥ يَحْيَىٰ لَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مِن قَبْلُ سَمِيًّۭا
ar.verse_8: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَٰمٌۭ وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًۭا وَقَدْ بَلَغْتُ مِنَ ٱلْكِبَرِ عِتِيًّۭا
ar.verse_9: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌۭ وَقَدْ خَلَقْتُكَ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ تَكُ شَيْـًۭٔا
ar.verse_10: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱجْعَل لِّىٓ ءَايَةًۭ ۚ قَالَ ءَايَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ ٱلنَّاسَ ثَلَٰثَ لَيَالٍۢ سَوِيًّۭا
ar.verse_11: فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلْمِحْرَابِ فَأَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِمْ أَن سَبِّحُوا۟ بُكْرَةًۭ وَعَشِيًّۭا
ar.verse_12: يَٰيَحْيَىٰ خُذِ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ بِقُوَّةٍۢ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَٰهُ ٱلْحُكْمَ صَبِيًّۭا
ar.verse_13: وَحَنَانًۭا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَزَكَوٰةًۭ ۖ وَكَانَ تَقِيًّۭا
ar.verse_14: وَبَرًّۢا بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ وَلَمْ يَكُن جَبَّارًا عَصِيًّۭا
ar.verse_15: وَسَلَٰمٌ عَلَيْهِ يَوْمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوْمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ يُبْعَثُ حَيًّۭا
ar.verse_16: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَٰبِ مَرْيَمَ إِذِ ٱنتَبَذَتْ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا مَكَانًۭا شَرْقِيًّۭا
ar.verse_17: فَٱتَّخَذَتْ مِن دُونِهِمْ حِجَابًۭا فَأَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْهَا رُوحَنَا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَهَا بَشَرًۭا سَوِيًّۭا
ar.verse_18: قَالَتْ إِنِّىٓ أَعُوذُ بِٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيًّۭا
ar.verse_19: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَٰمًۭا زَكِيًّۭا
ar.verse_20: قَالَتْ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَٰمٌۭ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِى بَشَرٌۭ وَلَمْ أَكُ بَغِيًّۭا
ar.verse_21: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌۭ ۖ وَلِنَجْعَلَهُۥٓ ءَايَةًۭ لِّلنَّاسِ وَرَحْمَةًۭ مِّنَّا ۚ وَكَانَ أَمْرًۭا مَّقْضِيًّۭا
ar.verse_22: ۞ فَحَمَلَتْهُ فَٱنتَبَذَتْ بِهِۦ مَكَانًۭا قَصِيًّۭا
ar.verse_23: فَأَجَآءَهَا ٱلْمَخَاضُ إِلَىٰ جِذْعِ ٱلنَّخْلَةِ قَالَتْ يَٰلَيْتَنِى مِتُّ قَبْلَ هَٰذَا وَكُنتُ نَسْيًۭا مَّنسِيًّۭا
ar.verse_24: فَنَادَىٰهَا مِن تَحْتِهَآ أَلَّا تَحْزَنِى قَدْ جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحْتَكِ سَرِيًّۭا
ar.verse_25: وَهُزِّىٓ إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ ٱلنَّخْلَةِ تُسَٰقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًۭا جَنِيًّۭا
ar.verse_26: فَكُلِى وَٱشْرَبِى وَقَرِّى عَيْنًۭا ۖ فَإِمَّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ ٱلْبَشَرِ أَحَدًۭا فَقُولِىٓ إِنِّى نَذَرْتُ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ صَوْمًۭا فَلَنْ أُكَلِّمَ ٱلْيَوْمَ إِنسِيًّۭا
ar.verse_27: فَأَتَتْ بِهِۦ قَوْمَهَا تَحْمِلُهُۥ ۖ قَالُوا۟ يَٰمَرْيَمُ لَقَدْ جِئْتِ شَيْـًۭٔا فَرِيًّۭا
ar.verse_28: يَٰٓأُخْتَ هَٰرُونَ مَا كَانَ أَبُوكِ ٱمْرَأَ سَوْءٍۢ وَمَا كَانَتْ أُمُّكِ بَغِيًّۭا
ar.verse_29: فَأَشَارَتْ إِلَيْهِ ۖ قَالُوا۟ كَيْفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كَانَ فِى ٱلْمَهْدِ صَبِيًّۭا
ar.verse_30: قَالَ إِنِّى عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ ءَاتَىٰنِىَ ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَجَعَلَنِى نَبِيًّۭا
ar.verse_31: وَجَعَلَنِى مُبَارَكًا أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُ وَأَوْصَٰنِى بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ مَا دُمْتُ حَيًّۭا
ar.verse_32: وَبَرًّۢا بِوَٰلِدَتِى وَلَمْ يَجْعَلْنِى جَبَّارًۭا شَقِيًّۭا
ar.verse_33: وَٱلسَّلَٰمُ عَلَىَّ يَوْمَ وُلِدتُّ وَيَوْمَ أَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ أُبْعَثُ حَيًّۭا
